content.question: The rate of change, <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the number of people entering a movie theater is modeled by a logistic differential equation. The capacity of the theater is 500 people. At a certain time, the number of people in the theater is 100 and is increasing at the rate of 50 per minute. Which of the following differential equations could describe this situation?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, one eighth times, open parenthesis, 500 minus P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 50, end fraction, times P, times, open parenthesis, 500 minus P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 800, end fraction, times P, times, open parenthesis, 500 minus P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>800</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 1200, end fraction, times P, times, open parenthesis, 500 plus P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 800, end fraction, times P, times, open parenthesis, 500 minus P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>800</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
